comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: granada is a team that was in the league so it was expected that they would be able to return, but what leaves me most shocked is to see that alaves, the east, Eibar have not managed to stay in the second position, these teams that have already been in the league recently they should have more ability to return to the main league, but what you see is that they are not with much difference in relation to the teams that did not reach the league recently, for example las palmas is a team that has not been in the league recently, but La Palma does very well playing against those teams that I mentioned, I'm talking about the last games, La Palma didn't lose in their last game against Levante, against Alaves, against Eibarso you see that the fact that a team is in the main league does not make it very strong in relation to the second division team, it is true that when a team is relegated, it loses most of its squad because nobody likes to play in the second division. Anyway, I don't see much potential at Granada or La Palma, so I see that they will be relegated from La Liga next season. the only way to not be relegated next season would be if they managed to make a lot of financial investment in the team, they would have to buy a lot of good players and not make the old and serious mistake of dismissing the coach that led them to move up in the division

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Granada won and their main goalscorer Uzuni even made a beautiful gesture in the last game when they were awarded Champions of La Liga 2.He proposed his girlfriend/fiance for marriage I assume and she accepted,I think it is the first time that this happens in a lower division as most likely in some other leagues than top 5 in Europe this has happened a couple of times.Granada was steady during all this past season they fully deserved to be playing in La Liga next season,while Granada from what I recall has been more a team of La Liga 2 in general these last years have made good progress to be in La Liga quite a lot of seasons.

comments.author: macson
comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on May 30, 2023, 07:28:10 PMGranada won and their main goalscorer Uzuni even made a beautiful gesture in the last game when they were awarded Champions of La Liga 2.He proposed his girlfriend/fiance for marriage I assume and she accepted,I think it is the first time that this happens in a lower division as most likely in some other leagues than top 5 in Europe this has happened a couple of times.Granada was steady during all this past season they fully deserved to be playing in La Liga next season,while Granada from what I recall has been more a team of La Liga 2 in general these last years have made good progress to be in La Liga quite a lot of seasons.in the season 2021/22, Granada and Levante were relegated from La Liga 1 because they were unable to keep up with the performance of other teams, while in the 22/23 season, Granada underwent many changes and even they have a top score in La Liga 2 on their team (Uzuni) and top assists in their team (Callejon)season 23/24 will start soon and i am curious if espanyol and elche will be able to return to la liga 1 while granada and las palmas will be relegated back to la liga 2.the competition in La Liga 2 is actually not that tight, teams that are used to playing in La Liga 1 will easily enter the top 3 in La Liga 2 and go back up to La Liga 1.

comments.author: Renampun
comments.body: Andorra vs Cartagena took place in a fierce manner and the hosts won with a narrow score of 3-2 and the three Andorra goals were made by Nieto because of the hat trick in this match, for a while Nieto was at the top of the Segunda Division scorers.in another match between zaragoza vs valladolid it was also balanced, it's just that the hosts (zaragoza) who were luckier managed to score a goal in the 31st minute, this result shows that valladolidd's performance is very bad, if it continues like this then they will not be able to return to la liga 1.
